name: Writing Stickiness Enhancement Rubric
description: Evaluation criteria for SUCCESs model application quality

criteria.name: SUCCESs Analysis Quality
criteria.description: Thoroughness of initial analysis against all 6 SUCCESs principles

scores.1: No systematic analysis; principles not assessed individually
scores.2: Superficial analysis; some principles assessed but scores unjustified
scores.3: Adequate analysis; all 6 principles assessed with basic reasoning
scores.4: Good analysis; all principles assessed with specific evidence from text
scores.5: Comprehensive analysis; all principles assessed with detailed evidence, specific weaknesses identified, and improvement opportunities noted

criteria.name: Improvement Targeting
criteria.description: Whether improvements focus on the weakest principles rather than already-strong ones

scores.1: No targeted improvements; changes are random or unfocused
scores.2: Improvements scattered across principles without priority
scores.3: Some focus on weak principles but effort spread too thin
scores.4: Good focus on 2-3 weakest principles with specific improvements
scores.5: Excellent targeting; weakest principles identified and improved with specific, effective techniques

criteria.name: Stickiness Score Improvement
criteria.description: Measurable improvement in stickiness score from before to after

scores.1: No measurable improvement; score unchanged or decreased

criteria.name: Accuracy Preservation
criteria.description: Whether stickiness enhancements maintain factual accuracy and truthfulness

scores.1: Accuracy sacrificed for impact; claims exaggerated or fabricated
scores.2: Some accuracy concerns; statistics or examples stretched beyond truth
scores.3: Mostly accurate; minor embellishments but core truth preserved
scores.4: Accurate; all enhancements truthful and well-sourced
scores.5: Fully accurate; stickiness achieved through legitimate techniques without any distortion

criteria.name: Before/After Comparison
criteria.description: Quality of the before/after presentation showing specific improvements

scores.1: No comparison provided; user can't see what changed
scores.2: Vague comparison; changes described but not shown
scores.3: Basic comparison; before/after shown but principles not labeled
scores.4: Good comparison; before/after with principle labels showing specific techniques used
scores.5: Excellent comparison; before/after with scores, principle annotations, and explanation of why each change works

passing_note: Average score must be >= 3.5 for stickiness enhancement to be considered complete. Scores below 3 in 'Accuracy Preservation' require revision.
